description: A pliable but hefty layer of living plant matter.
//: bark can photosynthesize, so all of Plant's integrated armors are flagged transparent

description: A powerful layer of bark, thicker in parts.
Your bark is spread evenly across your body.
Your bark is pulled together to protect your torso.
Your bark is latticed into a larger frame.
A coat of soft plumage, growing right out of the skin to cover the head and much of the body.
A light coat of fur that grows across much of the body.
A warm furry hide.
A heavy shag carpet of fur, somewhere between a ballistic vest and attic insulation.
While still formidable, this furry hide has lost a lot of its bulk to better endure the summer months.
The shaggy fur of a wild beast.
A covering of fur that has thinned out for the summer.
The fur of a proud, wise creature.
A pile of fur around the neck, protecting from foes that go for the throat.
Skin like a spilled tub of paints, splattered in abstract shapes of hide, fur, and scale.
A hideous amalgam of scale, skin, and fur, knotted with osteoderms and patches of shining scales.
A dense calico of scale and fur compete with variegated skin, feathers, and horn buds across this armored hide.
These are much better than puny human mouthparts.
Your fangs have properly developed, and are prepared for the kill.  They are easier to use against prey that is vulnerable or webbed.

Though this tongue fits neatly within the mouth, it can extend to an astonishing length.  Sharp chitin barbs like a grotesque parody of a cat's tongue line the surface, and the barb at the tip looks more like a whaler's harpoon than something that belongs in a mouth.
Unnaturally smooth skin made of soft chitin.  Though soft and pliable, it's tougher than human flesh.
Armored plates of chitin which form a hardened shell around much of the body.
The exoskeleton is soft and vulnerable.  It would be best to hide until it hardens.
//: Freshly molted bugs have semi-transparent chitin.

description: A tremendous crustacean shell that covers the body in articulated plates.
This recently-molted carapace is still soft, and will need time to harden before it provides proper protection.
A powerful tool for snatching fish or breaking open shells.
A bulky calcareous shell, with most of the torso tucked up inside.
A large mollusk shell, big enough for its owner to retract their body into or even store a few items inside.
A pearlescent mollusk shell, beautiful to behold and large enough for its owner to hide inside of or store a few items.
Soft, flexible scales cover the lower legs and feet.  Though not especially tough, they provide some protection.
Scales, like those of a fish or a snake, grow in patches over the skin.
A sheen of scales covering most of the skin.  They are tough, but remain smooth and flexible.
An iridescent sheen of fine scales growing over the skin.
A tough hide plated with scales and bony ridges.
Highly protective lenses which can retract into frames bolted right into the user's skull.  They provide near-total protection for the eyes and even function underwater.

Transparent scales seal the corneas behind a firm but flexible lens.  It's enough to keep water and most irritants at bay, and it would be very difficult to sneak up on one who sleeps with their eyes open.
Compound eyes on rigid stalks which can fold back against the head.

Thousands of ommatidea tesselate into a pair of eyes.  Each jewel-hard hexagonal lens picks up the dominant color in its field of view, rendering a single pixel to the image composited by the viewer's brain.
Long, sharp fingernails, thickened and durable enough to be dangerous.  On close examination, these don't quite look human.
Small steel blades peek from beneath the fingernails, like a manicure from hell.
Long, sharp claws at the tips of the fingers.
The suckers on the paddle-shaped feeding tentacles bear swiveling hooks of wickedly sharp chitin, perfect for snaring prey.
Rows of jagged teeth, essentially a biological chainsaw.  They're best used in deep water.
A pair of fangs sharp and sturdy enough to use in combat.
A wicked pair of fangs, pointed and surgically sharp.
A pair of enormous protruding fangs, strong enough to punch through bone.
A pair of chisel-like incisors which protrude from the upper and lower jaw.
Most people's mouths aren't as wide as their head.  This one is.
A stout, curved beak, like a parrot's.  It's sharp and looks like it could deliver a formidable bite.
A sharp, pointed beak.  The surrounding structure seems fully capable of absorbing the shock of it jackhammering into wood or bone.
A pair of hard, solid hooves sheathing the unguligrade feet in a protective layer of horn.
Curved talons adorn the feet like sickles, perfect for the killing blow.
Curved claws adorn the feet, ideal for gripping perch and prey alike.
A pair of short horns protruding from the scalp.
A pair of short antlers, still covered in fuzzy velvet.  Until they're fully grown in, they likely won't be much use outside of a grapple.
Curled horns, like those of a ram.
Long, stabbing horns protruding from the skull.
A regal pair of branching antlers.
Bolted to the bone, a set of interlocking subdermal plates protect the skull and cervical vertebrae from trauma.
